quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Movie and Grown Ups
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, ups, laminsoff. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which statement is true about Anne Hennis Trotter, popular as “Mad” Anne?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Mildred Fish Harnack was the only American woman executed for treason by Hitler.
What statement is true about Rosanna Waters Farrow?

options.text: She ransomed three of her sons from execution during the American Revolutionary War.
She fought alongside her husband during the American Revolutionary War.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She ransomed three of her sons from execution during the American Revolutionary War.

questions.question: What nickname was placed on the Japanese torpedo used at Pearl Harbor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Long Lance

questions.question: In the movie Grown Ups, Eric Laminsoff had two children with his wife Sally. They had a four year old son who did what that got his father crazy?

options.text: He still suck on a pacifier.
He wasnt potty trained and made in his diaper.
He still got breast fed at the age of four.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He still got breast fed at the age of four.

questions.question: The five guys from the movie Grown Ups play a game that they used to play with each other when they were kids. What game do they play?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arrow Roulette

questions.question: Nancy Hart Douglas was a Confederate scout, guide and spy during the American Civil War.
Who was the army general in command of the Hawaiian Islands at the time of the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: General Short

questions.question: Which statement is true about Harriet Prudence Patterson Hall?

options.text: She was a Confederate spy during the Civil War.
She delivered an important message to the American Army during the American Revolutionary War.
She was a soldier during the American Revolutionary War.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She delivered an important message to the American Army during the American Revolutionary War.

questions.question: In the movie Grown Ups, Lenny runs into an old nemesis at a restaurant. What is his name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dickie Bailey

questions.question: Who was the first woman to receive a pension from the U.S government as a disabled soldier?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Margaret Cochran Corbin

questions.question: Which of these women was a lighthouse keeper who tended the Matinicus Rock Light, in Maine during a severe winter storm?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abigail (Abbie) Burgess Grant

questions.question: All of the guys from the movie Grown Ups returned home to go to their ex coachs funeral. Where did the funeral take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New England

questions.question: In the movie Grown Ups when the guys were younger, they won a basketball championship in junior high school. What was their coachs name?
Lucy Adams Hart went to Washington to persuade President Lincoln into bringing her husband home during Civil War.

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Character and Novel Catch-22
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, john, squadron. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these is not a quote from the novel Catch-22?

options.text: He had decided to live forever or die in the attempt, and his only mission each time he went up was to come down alive.
Freedom is the freedom to say that two plus two makes four. If that is granted, all else follows.
It doesnt make sense. It isnt even good grammar. What the hell does it mean to disappear somebody?
Open your eyes, Clevinger. It doesnt make a damned bit of difference who wins the war to someone whos dead.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Freedom is the freedom to say that two plus two makes four. If that is granted, all else follows.

questions.question: What other novel by Joseph Heller further explores the motif of bureaucratic absurdity and features some of the major Catch-22 characters?

options.text: Portrait of an Artist, as an Old Man

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Closing Time

questions.question: Which of these statements refers to Mary Perkins Bradbury, an English-born woman convicted and sentenced to death for witchcraft in Salem, Massachusetts in 1692?

options.text: Her family immigrated to America in 1631.
She married Thomas Bradbury of Salisbury in 1936.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of the following is not a character described in the novel Catch-22?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nurse Ratched

questions.question: During which war is Joseph Hellers satirical novel Catch-22 set?
The exploits of fictional character John Yossarian are based on Joseph Hellers own experiences.
Hannah Snell hid her true sex while serving in a regiment of the Royal Marines.
What Catch-22 character is a U.S. Army B-25 bombardier, whose main concern is the idea that everyone is trying to kill him?
The Scottish medium Helen Duncan was one of the last persons to be imprisoned under the English Witchcraft Act of 1735.
This Catch-22 character buys and sells goods through black market channels and has no allegiance to any country, person or principle unless it pays him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Milo Minderbinder

questions.question: Who directed the 1970 movie Catch-22 which was adapted from Joseph Hellers novel of the same name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Nichols

questions.question: In the novel Catch-22, the airmen of the fictional 256th squadron are based on this Mediterranean island.
Who are the moles working for the FBI in Season 7 of 24?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sean and Erika

questions.question: A recurring joke in the novel Catch-22 is that this character bears a striking resemblance to Henry Fonda.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Major Major Major Major

questions.question: Mammy Kate was a slave owned by Stephen Heard, a future governor of Georgia.

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Witchcraft and 1600s
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, massachusetts, corgi. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Is it true that the Pembroke Welsh Corgi is the preferred breed of Queen Elizabeth II?
Elizabeth Knapp of Groton, Massachusetts was a sixteen-year-old servant in the house of Rev. Samuel Willard and she presumably became “possessed” by the devil in 1671.
Which of the following is true about Elizabeth Howe, one of the defendants in the Salem witch trials?

options.text: Her resting place is a crevice on Gallows hill, Salem.
She was accused of afflicting several girls.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Rebecca Nurse was one of three sisters accused and imprisoned for witchcraft during the infamous Salem witch trials in the 1600s.
The song Fallin was a huge hit song for this singer in 2001.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alicia Keys

questions.question: What happened with Rebecca Elson Mudge Greensmith and her husband from Hartford, Connecticut, who were suspected of witchcraft in the 1600s?

options.text: They were found guilty and hung.
They were neither accused of witchcraft, nor hanged
They were both accused of witchcraft.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They were found guilty and hung.

questions.question: In what was Elizabeth Blanchard, wife of farmer Joshua Garlick from East Hampton, Long Island, accused?

options.text: Causing the death of her child

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both of these

questions.question: The Australian Shepherd is used for herding.
English-born woman Mary Bliss Pasons was repeatedly tried as a witch and forced to suffer many indignities by her jealous neighbours in Northampton, Massachusetts in the middle of the 1600s.
The song Get Ur Freak On was a colossal hit song for this singer in 2001.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Missy Elliott

questions.question: The Cockerpoo is a Cocker Spaniel Poodle Mix.
Martha Schuler from Lindheim, Germany was arrested, imprisoned, tortured and eventually burned for witchcraft In 1364.
Is it true that Bichons were court dogs during the Middle Ages?
Alice was one of the seven Pendle Witches executed on August 20, 1612 in England.
The Australian Shepherd is a breed of dog developed in Australia.

quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, title, table. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the name of the wizard who created the Round Table according to some Arthurian legends?

questions.question: What English musician, known for the intellectual depth of his work, recorded the songs Thursdays Child, Love You Till Tuesday, Friday On My Mind, Drive-In Saturday?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Bowie

questions.question: The song Saturday Night Divas was performed by this English girl group that popularized the term Girl Power.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Spice Girls

questions.question: What song, featured in the 2009 movie Hes Just Not That into You opens with the lines,
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Friday Im in Love

questions.question: What pop rock band recorded the song Manic Monday on their studio 1986 album Different Light?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bangles

questions.question: Which knight of the Round Table is raised by the Lady of the Lake after the death of his father?
What song by The Carpenters went to #2 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart and was later covered by Olivia Newton-John as a tribute to Karen Carpenter?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rainy Days and Mondays

questions.question: Sunday Bloody Sunday is an overtly political song describing a 1972 incident in which 26 civil rights protesters were shot in Northern Ireland. What band recorded the song?
What Sunday song is not correctly matched with the band that performed it?

options.text: Easy Like Sunday Morning - Pink Floyd
Sunday Afternoon In The Park - Van Halen
Emotional Rescue Sunday Bloody Sunday - Smashing Pumkins

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Easy Like Sunday Morning - Pink Floyd

questions.question: The  2001 song Standing Still was a hit for this female singer.
What famous duo released their debut album, Wednesday Morning, 3 A.M. in 1964?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Simon  Garfunkel

questions.question: Complete the title of a 1973 rock song performed by Elton John and covered by W.A.S.P., Queen and The Who.:
What song, written by Keith Richards of the Rolling Stones, contains the lyrics, Who could hang a name on you?/When you change with every new day/Still Im gonna miss you.?

options.text: On a Tuesday in Amsterdam Long Ago

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ruby Tuesday

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Jane Austen and Knight
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, novels, table. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following novels was not written by Jane Austen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wuthering Heights

questions.question: To what ethnic group did legendary King Arthur belong?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Britons

questions.question: How old was Jane Austen when she died?
Which knight of the Round Table consumes a love potion and falls helplessly in love with an Irish Princess?
Who was Jane Austens closest friend and confidante?

options.text: Her two brothers James and Henry

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Her sister Cassandra Elizabeth

questions.question: According to a Middle English romance, this knight of the Round Table accepts a challenge from a mysterious warrior who is completely green.
This knight of the Round Table is the illegitimate son of Lancelot and Elaine and one of the three achievers of the Holy Grail.
Jane Austen had seven siblings.
What is the name of the traitor who, according to Arturian legend, fought Arthur at the Battle of Camlann?
Which one-handed knight of the Round Table returns Excalibur to the Lady of the Lake according to Arthurian legend?
Jane Austens works can be classified as which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Romantic fiction

questions.question: Who did Merlin reserve the Perilous Seat for according to Arthurian legend?

options.text: the knight who would kill Mordred
the knight who would become a traitor
the knight who would be successful in the quest of the Holy Grail

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the knight who would be successful in the quest of the Holy Grail

questions.question: Jane Austen lived her entire life in a close-knit family.
Which Jane Austen novel focuses on Catherine Morland, a girl who likes reading Gothic novels?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Northanger Abbey

questions.question: According to Arthurian legend, the Round Table stands in a mighty castle located in this mythical city.
